title: Incorrect type definition for genReqId in FastifyServerOptions
body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] I have written a descriptive issue title
- [X] I have searched existing issues to ensure the bug has not already been reported


### Fastify version

4.17.0

### Plugin version

_No response_

### Node.js version

Irrelevant

### Operating system

Linux

### Operating system version (i.e. 20.04, 11.3, 10)

Irrelevant

### Description

The type of `genReqId` server option [implies](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/0dd31b71eeb79da4a43738473eaebcf5844fc8d4/fastify.d.ts#L112) its only argument is an instance of `FastifyRequest`:

```ts
    genReqId?: <...>(req: FastifyRequest<...>) => string,
```

However, in practice [it is given](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/0dd31b71eeb79da4a43738473eaebcf5844fc8d4/lib/route.js#L397) `RawRequest` (e.g. `http.IncomingMessage`):

```js
function routeHandler (req, res, params, context, query) {
    const id = genReqId(req)
``` 

while `FastifyRequest` is [created only later](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/0dd31b71eeb79da4a43738473eaebcf5844fc8d4/lib/route.js#L466) in this function.

### Steps to Reproduce

To reproduce, let's extend the test in [`test/genReqId.js`](https://github.com/fastify/fastify/blob/0dd31b71eeb79da4a43738473eaebcf5844fc8d4/test/genReqId.test.js#L11):

```js
    genReqId: function (req) {
      t.hasProp(req, 'id')
      t.hasProp(req, 'raw')
      return 'a'
    }
```
This test will now fail, because these two props normally found in `FastifyRequest` instance do not actually exist. (Well, `id` value is supposed to be provided by `genReqId` in the first place)

### Expected Behavior

The type definition should be something like this:

```ts
genReqId?: <...>(req: RawRequest) => string,
```
